title: Islamic Law and the Family
description:
This course will offer an historical and comparative focus
on Islamic family law. It will begin by providing a basic
overview of Islamic law generally and then turn to examine
Islamic family law specifically. It will then cover major
topics that arise in Islamic family law under the classical
Islamic legal tradition. It will conclude by exploring how
many of those issues arise in some modern contexts, as
Islamic family law is applied both inside and outside of the
Muslim world.
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent.
preclusion: LL4311V/LL5311V/LL6311V Islamic Law and the Family
